author: hsiaowei
content:
Hi! Some reasons for pro-fork-epoch:
1. PeerDAS requires nodes upgrade together as much as a hard fork level. Specifically, we want all nodes to switch together at the the specific epoch and deprecate the old blob sidecar subnets simultaneously.
2. PeerDAS may be essential for the blob count bump EIP. Maybe better to delay the decision of `*_ACTIVATION_EPOCH` to the point we have more data of the chance to bump blob count. Because if we do so, we may have to revert back to `_FORK_EPOCH` again. üòÖ
